EU to loan €90 billion to Ukraine while delaying Mercosur deal
subhead: The aid allocated to Kyiv will take the form of a zero-interest loan, after the bloc failed to agree on using frozen Russian assets. Meanwhile, the free trade agreement with the South American Mercosur trade bloc was postponed to January, as Italy joined France in blocking it.
byline: By Virginie Malingre (Brussels, Europe bureau) and Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau)

title: French lawmakers fail to agree on state budget bill
Putin says Russian troops 'are advancing along the entire line of contact' in Ukraine
Louvre staff call off strike and museum to open 'as normal,' unions say
subhead: Union leaders on Friday said staff at the Paris museum had voted against another day of stoppages, but warned of future industrial action because of 'insufficient progress' in talks with management and the Culture Ministry.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: French public debt reaches a new high at 117.4% of GDP
subhead: France's public debt has now reached €3.482 trillion, the national statistics bureau announced on December 19. It stands at 117.4% of GDP, a record level outside times of war or pandemic. With no sign of fiscal recovery, analysts have warned that a market crisis cannot be ruled out.

title: French anesthetist sentenced to life in prison: 'We cannot bring back our loved ones, but at least there is a semblance of justice'
subhead: A criminal court in eastern France found Frédéric Péchier guilty of 30 poisonings: 12 murders and 18 attempted murders. His sentence includes a 22-year period during which he is ineligible for parole and a permanent ban from practicing medicine. His lawyer announced he will appeal the verdict.

title: Trump dogged by cost of living crisis and Republican revolt
subhead: The US president tried to defuse Americans' dissatisfaction with the economy in a televised address on Wednesday. He continued to blame Joe Biden, but struggled to grasp the extent of the issue – provoking tensions within his own party.

'It is easier to flatter the people than to serve. Therein lies the last obstacle to an RN victory in 2027'
subhead: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhead: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.
byline: By Raphaëlle Bacqué (Benque (southwestern France), special correspondent)

title: Minnesota's Somali community stands up to Trump: 'We are no less American than other Americans'
subhead: After the revelation of a Covid-19 relief fraud scheme involving nearly 80 individuals of Somali origin, the American president deployed immigration police within the large Somali community in Minnesota, whose members are predominantly US citizens.
